Summer Camp Raleigh

English Writing Summer Camp Raleigh

(Live online, small group)

The Brain Adventure camp courses teach foundation skills to prepare your child for the next school year - English Writing. This is an important skill for their long term success.

Kids nowadays write the way they text. There is no discipline in creating good sentence structure There is no planning prior to writing the paragraphs, and kids often times write whatever comes to their mind. This is why they get blanked out and don't know where to start.

In our English Writing Class Summer Camp Raleigh, we target these weakness in a step by step approach, delivered in an interactive and fun lesson. We start with grammar and sentence structure, then move into organizing ideas and vocabulary usage. It is a truly fun learning experience, a unique summer camp for children.

For the advanced group (Grade 7-8), we move into essay writing and critical thinking in week 3 and 4.

Welcome to join us in English Writing Summer Camp Raleigh.

English Writing Raleigh for Junior Elementary (G5-6)

English Writing Summer Camp Raleigh

English Writing Summer Camp Raleigh - Junior Elementary (Grade 5-6)

(3 weeks, 5 classes per week, 2 hours / class, Grade 5-6). $220 / week
Live Instructor

Our English Writing Summer Camp Raleigh (Junior G5-6) focuses on foundation skills including sentence structure, grammar, and vocabulary building. Students will learn how to write paragraph, starting from sentences. How to use adjective properly? What is proposition and how to use it? For vocabulary building, for instance, many students make the mistake of memorizing the words, or using highly complex words in an incorrect context. Our class shows the student on understanding the meaning of the words, and writing sentences base on that understanding.

This English Writing Summer Camp Raleigh is a unique opportunity for your child to learn the foundations of English writing with professional lessons from our teachers and writing project for practice.

Welcome to join us in English Writing Summer Camp Raleigh

English Writing Raleigh for Senior Elementary (G7-8)

English Writing Summer Camp Raleigh

English Writing Summer Camp Raleigh - Senior Elementary (G7-8)

(4 weeks, 5 classes per week, 2 hours / class, Grade 7-8). $250 / week
Live Instructor

Our English Writing Summer Camp Raleigh (Senior G7-8) starts with the foundation skills, such as sentence structures. Then we will move into essay writing section. It is critical to prepare some foundation skills for grades 9 and up in order to succeed in high school.

How do you write an attention-getting introduction?The excellent way to pique the reader's interest coule be a piece of writing with an attention-getting introduction. A hook for an essay might be a question, a surprise, or a quotation that piques the reader's interest and makes them want to read on to discover what occurs next.

What distinguishes a good thesis from a bad thesis? The characteristic that distinguishes an excellent essay from a bad essay is mostly content. The writer must have something important or significant to say, and he or she must communicate it with precision, specific terminology, and evidence when needed. A successful essay will be well-organized and clear of the clutter that obstructs effective communication: grammatical faults, syntax issues, diction lapses, and spelling errors.

How to express your ideas in a concise and clear manner?The first step is to determine your essential message before writing. You could consider what you want the other person to learn, to know, to understand as a result of listening to you. Organize your thoughts in your essay to ensure clear communication.

All of these are essential steps in writing a clear, concise and fluid essay.

Welcome to join us in English Writing Summer Camp Raleigh

Meet our English Teachers

English Writing Summer Camp Raleigh

Diana J.

PhD candidate, English literature, York University. She has 6+ years of experience teaching students from grade 4 to 12. This includes teaching first year English tutorials at York University.

Diana explains the common challenge for children in sentence structure and how our program will strengthen that foundation

Anthony M.

Master graduate, English literature, University of Toronto. Anthony has 3+ years of teaching experience, including his tenure at Queen Elizabeth team. Anthony is patient and detailed oriented and knows how to make online learning engaging !

FAQ - English Writing Summer Camp Raleigh

What is the goal of a summer camp Raleigh?

The study discovered that allowing children to take chances and face obstacles at camp helps them develop independence, resiliency, and self-esteem in a secure, supervised, and supportive setting.

What is the best age to go to summer camp Raleigh?

Children should be at least 7 years old before participating in one-week or longer overnight camp programmes, according to advisors from The Camp Experts & Teen Programs.

Why is summer camp Raleigh important to the life of a child?

A summer camp program provides a secure place for children to develop social skills, make decisions, and maybe even experience nature. In fact, early socialising may be more beneficial to growth and development than reading or eating veggies!

What happens at English writing summer camp Raleigh?

The English Writing Workshop is a teaching method that aims to help kids become more confident and proficient writers. Children get opportunity to work individually and with their peers during Writing Workshop. Selecting subjects, drafting, rewriting, editing, and releasing their own work are all part of the writing process for them.

What is an English summer camp Raleigh?

It's a mix of the English writing class and summer camp. It involves using games, music, and activities to teach English in a FUN, dynamic, and participatory manner. You'll spend some of your time at an English summer camp in English courses with students from all around the world, and the rest of your time participating in fascinating activities and excursions.
